publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; a few lines (alternating with black lines) of the incipit of Texts I-V; a few lines of the incipit of the “Synopsis of Classes” and the “Letter of Eusebius to Carpianus”; the heading of the texts; the word mǝʿǝraf “chapter” and the number of the chapters; the number and the “tituli” of the chapters; the title of the sections of Mäqdǝmä wangel; the word qämär “table” followed by a numeral on fol. 13ra; referrences to the tables in the “Letter of Eusebius to Carpianus” on fol. 15rb-va; numbers of the “tituli”; elements of the Canon tables; the postscripts and the notes containing the supposed language, place and date of origin of the Gospels; the legends of the miniatures; the Chi-rho signs; the qwǝm-signs; elements of the punctuation signs; the Ethiopic numerals or their elements.

msItem.note: - Details concerning types of postscripts included in the Gospels:
- Postscript containing the supposed language, place and date of origin (fol. 90ra)
- Postscript containing the supposed language, place and date of origin (fol. 126rb)
- Postscript containing the supposed language, place and date of origin (fol. 211va)
- Postscript containing the supposed language, place and date of origin (fol. 270rb-va)
- Note on some of the 72 disciples and note on the Episcopal Sees of the four Evangelists (fols. 270vb, 278r)
- Other signs used throughout the Ms.: zǝyyä-sign (fol. 26va l.16), qwǝm-sign (fol. 36rb l.20).

- For the notes on some of the 72 disciples and the note on the Episcopal Sees of the four Evangelists s. R. ZUURMOND, Novum Testamentum Aethiopice: the Synoptic Gospels, Part I: General Introduction, Part II: Edition of the Gospel of Mark, Stuttgart, 1989 (AeF 27), p. 17.
- The canon tables are distributed in 8 pages. The arches on fols. 20r and 20v have not been coloured.
- The chapters are separated from each other with one blank line.
- The numbers and “tituli” of the chapters are written in the upper margin, in red.

supportDesc.extent:
Made of 279.0 folios, of which blank 16v, 24v,128v, 279v, in 38.0 quires .
24.5 17.5 9.5

list.item: 4 XVII(4; s.l.: 1, no stub; 2, no stub/fols. 124r-127v)
8 XXXIV(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 237r-244v)

10
XXXVIII(10-1/fols. 271r-279v).
The structure of quires cannot be exactly determined, esp. of quires XI, XVII, XXI, XXXVII, XXXVIII, because of the condition of the Ms. Fol. 270 (quire XXXVIII) is misplaced, it should follow fol. 278.

supportDesc.condition: The front board is missing. The leather cover is missing; remains of the turn-ins and the parchment inlays are visible on the inner side of the back board. The original sewing is missing. Most probably the Ms. has been resewn at least twice with the same thread: the first resewing (4 stations used) is preserved in quires I-IV and from quire XXXV onwards while the second resewing (2 stations used) is visible in quires VI-XXXIV. Also, the Ms. has been crudely repaired with stitches of vegetal origin and with leather stitches. Most of the quires are reinforced on the spine folds by parchment guards, attached to the quires by means of chains of leather strips. Some fols. are affected by water and damaged by rodents. The inner corners of the upper and lower margins are damaged. From fol. 29 onwards the damage results in a minor or greater loss of text. Fol. 270 is misplaced, it should follow fol. 278.

layout.ab: Ruling pricks are visible (close to the outer edge).
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

handDesc.handNote: - tall, wide and broadly spaced letters
- the body of several letters is triangular (e.g.: ዐ, ለ, መ)
- the loops of መ are not separated

- the writing of the vowel marker of the seventh order of ሎ is unstable: it may be attached directly to the body of the letter, without the connecting line (e.g., fol. 79vb l.13) or it may be attached through a connecting line (e.g., fol. 79vb l. 18, 28)
- archaic form of ፩: triangular, upwards oriented (e.g., fol. 13rb l. 5),
- archaic form of “four” (triangular, downwards oriented), (e.g., fol. 13rb l. )
- form of “six”፮, looking like “compressed” numeral “seven”(e.g., fol. 13rb l.10).

decoDesc.decoNote: Fol. 1r (incipit of the Introduction): elaborate coloured (red, yellow, green, blue) ornamental band with three lateral extensions reaching the bottom of the page; the horizontal band extends to the top of the page; geometric motifs, interlaces.
Fol. 13va (incipit of the “Synopsis of Classes”): elaborate coloured (red, yellow, green, blue) ornamental band; floral and zoomorphic motifs, interlaces.

Fol. 15r (incipit of the Letter of Eusebius to Carpianus): elaborate coloured (red, yellow, green, blue) ornamental band with three short lateral extensions; the horizontal band extends to the top of the page; geometric and floral motifs, interlaces.
Fol. 21r (incipit of the List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Matthew): unfinished elaborate ornamental band; interlaces.

Fol. 25r (incipit of the Gospel of Matthew): elaborate coloured (red, yellow, green, blue) ornamental band with three lateral extensions reaching the bottom of the page; the horizontal band extends to the top of the page; geometric motifs, interlaces.

Fol. 92r (incipit of the Gospel of Mark): elaborate coloured (red, yellow, green, blue) ornamental band with three short lateral extensions; the horizontal band extends to the top of the page; floral and geometric motifs, interlaces.

Fol. 129r (incipit of the Gospel of Luke): elaborate coloured (red, yellow, green, blue) ornamental band with three lateral extensions running through the top half of the fol.; the horizontal band extends to the top of the page; floral and geometric motifs, interlaces.

Fol. 213r (incipit of the Gospel of John): elaborate coloured (red, yellow, green, blue) ornamental band with three short lateral extensions; the horizontal band extends to the top of the page; floral and geometric motifs, interlaces.

list.item:
Fol. 14va-b: Inventory of the church property.Fol. 14va: ንዋየ፡ ቅድሳት፡ ወመጻሕፍት፡ ዘጊደሬ፡ ወዘ፡ ፈልፈል፡ … [fol. 14vb] ወተጽሕፈት፡ ዛቲ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ በመዋዕለ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ወንጌላዊ፡ ፸፻፳ዓመተ፡ ምኅረት፡ አመ፡ ዓሱሩ፡ ወ፯ለወርኀጥር፡ በዘመነ፡ ለተክለ፡ ነብያት፡ አብነ[sic]:
The note is written in a mediocre hand, which is not very much posterior to that of the main text. The note mentions the date the year of mercy 7020 (= 1528 A.D.), 16 Ṭǝr, during the tenure of ʾabunä Täklä Näbiyat. It comprises of the list of paraphernalia, with their quantity, and the list of books (for some of them the title and the quantity are given).

Fol. 14vb: Qǝne-poem.Fol. 14vb: ዝቅኔ፡ ዘዘማርያም ፩ ዝሁር፡ ዕቡየ፡ ልብ፡ ቀታሊ፡ እንዘ፡ ገይስ፡ ያሌሊ፡ ደበረ፡ ወለተ ጽዮን፡ አመ፡ ዓርገ፡ እም፡ ፍኖተ፡ ሞአብ፡ ወኢሎፍሊ፡ እንዘ፡ ግዑረ፡ ሶበ፡ ይጸሊ፡ ኀበ፡ ፈጣሪሁ፡ ሕዝቅያስ፡ እንዘ፡ ኢምንተኒ፡ ይሄሊ፡ ተዝካረ፡ ረሰዮ፡ ለኵሉ፡ መሐሊ። ዘትሌዓሊ። ባሕቱ፡ ይበልኪ፡ ቃለ፡ ፈጣሪ፡ ከሃሊ። በዘባነ፡ ጴጥስ[sic]፡ ወጳውሊ፡ ቆሚ፡ ወታንቀልቅሊ፡ እስከ፡ ግብር፡ ይማስን፡ ወይበሊ።
The qǝne-poem is written in a mediocre hand. Above and below the poem the name of the type of the qǝne-poem, ʿǝṭanä mogär, has been written in a secondary hand.

Fol. 270va: Ownership note.Fol. 270va: ዝወንጌል፡ ዘአባ፡ በኃይ[ለ]፡ [ሥ]ሉስ፡ አቡሁ፡ በመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ለአባ፡ መርቆሬዎስ
The note is written in a mediocre hand, probably later than the main text, which resembles (or is identical) to the hand of Additio 3. The second line is partly illegible. It states that the Ms. belongs to ʾabba Bä-Ḫaylä Śǝllus (a probable reconstruction of the name), the spiritual father of ʾabba Märqorewos.

- Two “tituli” for the Gospel of Mark have been completed in a small script, in a secondary hand: fol. 91r. - Numerous corrections written over erasures, in the main hand: fols. 3va, 5ra, 5vb, 9rb, 10rb,13rb, 13vb, 33ra, 37v, 58va, 60ra, 73v, 88vb, 89ra, 96ra, 97ra, 104rb, 107ra, 109va, 123ra, 124rb, 131va, 136r, 148vb, 159vb, 163va, 181ra, 182ra, 209rb, 228rb, 231rb, 234rb, 237va, 238ra, 239vb, 240ra, 256ra, 268ra. - Corrections written over erasures, in a secondary hand: fols. 143ra, - Erasures: fols. 25vb, 26rab, 224vb. - Part of the line of the “tituli” is taken up: fols. 21rv, 22r, 90v, 127rv, 128r, 212r. - Part of the line of the “tituli” is taken down: fols. 21rv, 22r, 90v, 91r, 127rv, 128r. - Scribbles, doodles: fols. 6v, 91r, 109ra, 211rb, 270va, 278v, 279r.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards (the front board is missing), remains of the dark brown tooled leather cover (turn-ins) and an overback (?) on the inner side of the back board. Remains of a parchment pastedown on the inner side of the back board. Two pairs of sewing stations.
Most of the quires are reinforced with parchment guards, attached to the quires by means of side-stitches.
Blind tooled ornament on the dark brown leather turn-ins (at least 1 tool was used: double line fillet).

origin.origDate: The year of mercy 7020 mentioned in Additio 1 may refer to the year of the production of the book.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: According to Additio 3, at a certain time the Ms. belonged to ʾabba Bä-Ḫaylä Śǝllus.

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
